tldr: Affected versions of the package allow Cross-site Scripting (XSS) because it sets innerHTML with unsanitized user input at multiple locations, which allows attackers to inject malicious scripts into the page. This could lead to the execution of arbitrary JavaScript in the context of the user's browser, compromising security.
doest_this_affect_me: You are affected if you are using a version which is within vulnerability ranges
how_to_fix: Upgrade the `keycloakify` library to the patch version.
